clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study of Vedic Medicine for Type 2 Diabetes

lead_sponsor.agency: National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health (NCCIH)

clinical_study.source: National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health (NCCIH)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the feasibility and effectiveness of a multimodality Vedic Medicine treatment protocol for the management of newly diagnosed type 2 diabetes.

detailed_description.textblock: Maharishi Vedic Medicine (MVM) represents a synthesis of Vedic sciences, including Ayur-Veda, into a single, comprehensive, natural approach to health care. The objectives of this phase II pilot trial are to determine the feasibility, acceptability, and safety of implementing a multi-modality MVM intervention for newly diagnosed type 2 diabetics, and to measure the impact of such a protocol on overall glycemic control.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Kaiser Permanente members
- Newly diagnosed type 2 Diabetes
- Baseline glycosylated hemoglobin level of 6.0-7.9.
Exclusion criteria:
- Pregnancy or nursing mother
- Currently taking warfarin
- Diagnosis of psychotic disorder or recent hospitalization for depression
- Unable to comply with or attend treatment sessions
